meanings.definition: The quality or state of being commercial.
meanings.sent1: The commercialities of the market drive competition.
meanings.sent2: She studied the commercialities of different businesses.
meanings.sent3: The professor joked about the commercialities of selling ice to polar bears.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, the commercialities are like a chess game.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the commercialities is crucial for success in business.

meanings.sent1: The city thrives on the commercialities of its bustling markets.
meanings.sent2: He manages the commercialities of the company with great skill.
meanings.sent3: The commercialities of the trade show kept everyone busy.
meanings.sent4: The commercialities of the stock market can be unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: She navigated through the commercialities of the business world confidently.

meanings.definition: The practices or principles of commerce.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the commercialities of supply and demand is essential.
meanings.sent2: The textbook covers the basic commercialities of economics.
meanings.sent3: The team discussed the commercialities of expanding their services.
meanings.sent4: His success in business is attributed to mastering the commercialities.
meanings.sent5: The course teaches the fundamental commercialities of marketing strategies.
